Chandradeep Pokhariya

Home Research Resume Blog

I am a MS (research) student at International Institute of Information Technology, Hyderabad, working under the guidance of Dr Avinash Sharma at CVIT and Dr Srinath Sridhar at Brown IVL. I am also collaborating with Dr Rahul Narain on enhancing Position-Based Dynamics (PBD) for complex material models.

My research thus far has spanned a diverse range of topics, including neural fields, hand-object grasp capture, textured cloth and human body reconstruction, neural surface parameterization and physics simulation. Throughout this exploration across various fields, I have discovered a strong interest in the areas of computational geometry, geometric modeling, and physics-based simulations.

In my leisure time I like to play fingerstyle guitar and Indian bamboo flute. I also love being in nature and have recently taken up boxing as a new hobby.

Feel free to contact me on Email / Twitter.

using jekyllBear theme.
